nodes.name: Re-Access Binary Data from Previous Node
nodes.creator: Lucas Peyrin

parameters.content:
## Re-Access Binary Data

This workflow demonstrates a powerful technique: **how to re-access binary data from any previous node in your workflow, even if an intermediate node removes it.**

This is crucial when you need to process binary files (like images, PDFs) across multiple steps, especially if a node in between doesn't preserve binary data by default.


### To get started:
1.  Click **Run Workflow**.
2.  Observe the output of the `Re-Access Binary Data from Previous Node` to see the binary data re-attached.


### Questions or Feedback?
For feedback, coaching, built-for-you workflows, or any questions, use my unified AI-powered contact form.

‚û°Ô∏è **[Get in Touch Here](https://api.ia2s.app/form/templates/academy)**

*Happy Automating! ‚ÄîLucas Peyrin*

This node fetches a binary image (the n8n logo) from a URL.

It's the source of the binary data we'll be working with.

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important Concept!**

By default, many n8n nodes (like the `Set` node in this case) **do not pass binary data** to subsequent nodes.

This node simulates a common scenario where binary data is "lost" in the flow, which the next `Code` node will address.

### The Magic Happens Here!

This `Code` node demonstrates how to **re-access binary data** from *any* previous node in the workflow, even if it was dropped by an intermediate node.

It uses:
*   `$(previousNodeName).item`: To get the full item from the specified previous node.
*   `this.helpers.prepareBinaryData()`: To correctly re-attach the binary data to the current item.

---

üí° **Customize:**
If you adapt this to your workflow, remember to update the `previousNodeName` variable in the code to match the name of the node that originally produced the binary data you want to retrieve.

main.node: Re-Access Binary Data from Previous Node
